column3: Nov 25 A divided federal appeals court said Chesapeake Energy Corp had no right to redeem $1.3 billion of notes early at a favorable price

DAL,Delta's breakaway pilots' union struggles in attempt to replace existing union Nov 25 A group of Delta Air Lines pilots seeking to replace the current pilots' union at the U.S. carrier are struggling to win enough support. ~

GS,Goldman, BASF, HSBC accused of metals price fixing -U.S. lawsuit NEW YORK, Nov 25 Goldman Sachs Group Inc, Germany's BASF SE and two other big platinum and palladium dealers have been sued in the United States in what the plaintiff's law firm called the first nationwide class action over alleged price-fixing of the metals. ~Fitch Affirms The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc.'s Ratings at 'A/F1'; Outlook Stable (The following statement was released by the rating agency) NEW YORK, November 25 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has affirmed The Goldman Sachs  Group, Inc.'s (Goldman) Issuer Default Rating (IDRs) at 'A/F1', Support Rating  at '1', Support Rating Floor (SRF) at 'A' and Viability Rating (VR) at 'a'. The  Rating Outlook is Stable. A full list of rating actions follows at the end of  this rating action commentary. The rating actions have been taken as part of a periodic review of the Global  Trading and Un ~Goldman ordered to speed up disclosure of profits on Libya trades LONDON, Nov 25 Goldman Sachs has been ordered to divulge earlier than planned the profits it made on trades it carried out for Libya's sovereign wealth fund, at the centre of a $1 billion legal battle, a representative of the fund told Reuters on Tuesday. ~The Goldman Sachs guide to LME warehousing: Andy Home LONDON September 17, 2010 would turn out to be a fateful day for the global aluminum market and for the London Metal Exchange (LME). ~COLUMN-The Goldman Sachs guide to LME warehousing: Andy Home (The opinions expressed here are those of the author, a columnist for Reuters.) ~
HCA,HCA hospitals halt use of uterine fibroid surgical tool Nov 25 HCA Holdings Inc, the largest for-profit U.S. hospital operator, said a procedure for removing uterine fibroids that has been linked to the spread of cancer will no longer be performed at its facilities. ~
HPQ,UPDATE 2-HP fourth-quarter revenue drops on weak enterprise demand Nov 25 Hewlett-Packard Co said its quarterly revenue fell in almost every business segment over the year, highlighting weaknesses ahead of the company's planned 2015 separation of its enterprise services from its traditional computer and printing units. ~CORRECTED-Weak enterprise demand hurts HP's fourth-quarter revenue Nov 25 Hewlett-Packard Co reported a 2.5 percent drop in quarterly revenue, hurt by weak sales to enterprise customers. ~
LLY,Once-weekly Lilly diabetes drug wins EU approval Nov 25 The European Commission has granted marketing approval to Eli Lilly and Co's injectable Trulicity treatment for adults with type 2 diabetes, the U.S. drugmaker said on Tuesday. ~
M,Facebook video draws Thanksgiving ads from Macy's, others NEW YORK, Nov 25 Macy's Inc, which traditionally kicks off the U.S. holiday shopping season with a nationally televised parade in Manhattan, also will join a handful of other companies this year parading their ads on Facebook's  fledgeling video feeds. ~
MSFT.O,Microsoft to pay China $140 mln for 'tax evasion' SEATTLE, Nov 25 China has levied about $140 million in back taxes from Microsoft Corp in the first major case concerning cross-border tax evasion in the country, as regulators ramp up pressure on U.S. corporations doing business there. ~
TIF,Tiffany same-store sales sparkle, shares hit record high Upscale jeweler Tiffany & Co  reported a better-than-expected rise in same-store sales, mainly due to strong demand in the Americas, sending its shares to a record high. | Video  ~US STOCKS-Wall St dips on consumer data, indexes near records * Dow down 0.1 pct, S&P; 500 down 0.2 pct, Nasdaq flat   (Updates to mid-morning trading) ~UPDATE 3-Tiffany same-store sales sparkle, shares hit record high * Cuts full-year sales forecast, citing strong dollar   (Adds link to graphic on Tiffany earnings) ~US STOCKS-Wall St edges up after GDP, consumer confidence data * Dow flat, S&P; 500 up 0.1 pct, Nasdaq up 0.2 pct   (Updates to open) ~US STOCKS-Futures point to higher open after strong GDP data * Futures up: Dow 33 pts, S&P; 3.25 pts, Nasdaq 9 pts   (Adds GDP data) ~US STOCKS-Futures tick up with indexes at records * Futures up: Dow 23 pts, S&P; 2.5 pts, Nasdaq 8.75 pts   (Adds Tiffany results) ~Tiffany sales miss estimates on weak demand in Japan Nov 25 Upscale jeweler Tiffany & Co  reported lower-than-expected quarterly sales due to weak demand in Japan. ~
TWX,China's Tencent partners with HBO for TV show streaming BEIJING, Nov 25 Chinese Internet firm Tencent Holdings Ltd is partnering with Time Warner Inc's  HBO network to stream its TV shows, which are known for their provocative content and may draw scrutiny from the country's authorities. ~
UTX,UPDATE 1-New UTC chief known to Wall Street, giving solace amid abrupt move Nov 24 United Technologies Corp's  appointment of Chief Financial Officer Gregory Hayes as chief executive is providing investors some comfort as they try to understand the abrupt departure of previous leader Louis Chenevert. ~
